Key Match Events: Tobias Harris had 24 points with 10 rebounds.
Cade Cunningham supplied 18 points for Detroit.
Malik Beasley had 12 points off the bench.
Tim Hardaway Jr. chipped in 11 points.
Jalen Duren added 10 points with 14 rebounds.
Miles Bridges led Charlotte with 20 points, nine rebounds, and five assists.
Mark Williams had 18 points and nine rebounds for the Hornets.
Charlotte held a 65-52 lead at halftime.
Seth Curry had a three-point play during the first half.
Bridges made a 31-foot 3-pointer at the halftime buzzer.
Detroit scored the first five points of the second half.
The Pistons reeled off a 12-2 run in the third quarter.
Detroit took a 79-78 lead on a Hardaway 3-pointer with 3:25 remaining in the third quarter.
The Pistons finished the third quarter on a 5-1 spurt to gain an 84-82 lead.
Cunningham hit a midrange jumper for a 94-90 lead with 3:10 left.
A Bridges turnover led to a Harris fast break layup for a 96-90 advantage.
Cunningham split two free throws with 19.3 seconds left.
Duren blocked a KJ Simpson shot.
Bridges missed a 3-point attempt and Hardaway clinched the Pistons’ win with a free throw.
